etymology.description: 丂(丂) (kǎo, 'fork in a tree') + two vertical strokes representing branches -> sound produced by wind blowing through branches -> meaning 'exhale'
etymology.interpretation: The character 兮 originally depicted a fork in a tree with branches above, symbolizing the sound of wind passing through branches, which metaphorically connects to the idea of exhaling.

examples.chinese: 他静坐禅房兮(他靜坐禪房兮)，缓缓呼出心中烦恼兮(緩緩呼出心中煩惱兮)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jìngzuò chánfáng xī, huǎnhuǎn hūchū xīnzhōng fánnǎo xī.
examples.english: He sits quietly in the meditation room, slowly exhaling his inner troubles.

examples.chinese: 他轻启薄唇兮(他輕啟薄唇兮)，缓缓吐纳幽香兮(緩緩吐納幽香兮)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qīngqǐ bóchún xī, huǎnhuǎn tùnà yōuxiāng xī.
examples.english: He gently parts his thin lips, slowly exhaling a fragrant breath.
